metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3798 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in openCryptoki. The openCryptoki Soft token does not check if an EC key is valid when an EC key is created via C_CreateObject, nor when C_DeriveKey is used with ECDH public data. This may allow a malicious user to extract the private key by performing an invalid curve attack.

criterions.comment: opencryptoki: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
